Package emissary.directory

Class HeartbeatManager

java.lang.Object
emissary.directory.HeartbeatManager
public class HeartbeatManager extends Object
Facility for directory instances to check up on each other by sending a heartbeat message

  • Constructor Details

    • HeartbeatManager

      public HeartbeatManager(String directoryKey, int initialDelaySeconds, int intervalSeconds)
      Setup to manage heartbeats to remote directories
      Parameters:
      directoryKey - Key for directory I act on behalf of
      initialDelaySeconds - seconds to wait before initial timer task
      intervalSeconds - how often the timeer task kicks off

    • HeartbeatManager

      public HeartbeatManager(String directoryKey, @Nullable List<String> dirList, int initialDelaySeconds, int intervalSeconds)
      Setup to manage heartbeats to remote directories
      Parameters:
      directoryKey - Key for directory I act on behalf of
      dirList - list of directory keys for remote directories
      initialDelaySeconds - seconds to wait before initial timer task
      intervalSeconds - how often the timeer task kicks off

      status - new status

    • takeFailureAction

      public void takeFailureAction(String key, boolean permanent)
      Notify our directory that there was a falure
      Parameters:
      key - string key of the directory that failed

    • heartbeat

      public final boolean heartbeat(String key)
      Send a heartbeat message to the directory represented by key and take follow-on actions as appropriate Called from the timer task normally, but can be called externally by the impatient
      Parameters:
      key - key representing the directory to heartbeat
      Returns:
      true if the directory referenced by key is up
      See Also:
      • DirectoryPlace.heartbeatRemoteDirectory(String)

    • getHeartbeat

      public static EmissaryResponse getHeartbeat(String fromPlace, String toPlace)
